intro: Vesicaria lasiocarpa, commonly known as the woolly bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that often appear in clusters. The plant is carnivorous, using specialized structures to trap and digest small aquatic organisms. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, typically in shallow, muddy habitats. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
